job.title: Researcher in Drilling Mechanics and Dynamics

description.p: Conducted research in drilling mechanics and dynamics.

bulletedlist.item:
Developed a computer model used to predict the transient dynamic behavior of drill bits.
Over 70k lines of C++ with a Qt UI and a custom physics and computational geometry engine.
The model uses a hybrid physics and data-driven approach to predict behavior.
The code was optimized using multithreading and high-performance computing techniques.
Oversaw the physics models, software design and architecture, and project management, ensuring software accuracy, timely deliverables, and adherence to budget, resulting in efficient project execution.
Developed a technique to reduce the cost of model fitting by an order of magnitude.
Transferred development to an overseas-based software team and managed them.

Conducted research that led to an improved theoretical understanding of lateral drill bit vibrations, which I used to develop novel techniques for designing drill bits. This enabled direct bit design, reducing reliance on trial-and-error methods.
Developed a technique used to interpret laboratory data. The technique is a physics-based approach that replaced the previous assumption-based method.
